a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.
The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0).
Permission to reproduce the graphic images in this archive has been granted by the owners of the originals for this publication only.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Judgments of People
bibl.orgName: The Charles E. Feinberg Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1839–1919, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original item.

revisionDesc.change: completed date information, changed paragraphs to abs
added schematron declaration, updated schema declaration, changed text type to annotations
Checked and revised bibliographical information and encoding.

body.ab: Make a piece (short—or longer) on the queer judgments both of communi- ties and ages, and of notable individuals as of Voltaire ab'tabout ShakspereShakespeare Byron, & Wordsworth ab'tabout the poets & as in Dictionary page 9359 when women's characters were first rattempted to be represented on the English stage by real women, actresses, they were angrily hissed off; it was considered indecent, beyond allowance.
The first persons that carried umbrellas in Europe were mobbed
